intro: Stachys obtusata, commonly known as bluntleaf betony, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a bluish-green hue. Its flowers are clustered in whorls at the ends of the stems, producing purple to pink blooms that attract pollinators. Stachys obtusata is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and historical use in herbal medicine.
